The '''Nobel Committee for Physics''' is the [[Nobel Committee]] responsible for proposing laureates for the [[Nobel Prize for Physics]].<ref name="CommitteePhysicsNobelprize">[https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/about/the-nobel-committee-for-physics: The Nobel Committee for Physics], accessed 2019-10-18</ref> The Nobel Committee for Physics is appointed by the [[Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences]]. It usually consists of Swedish professors of physics who are members of the Academy, although the Academy in principle could appoint anyone to the Committee.
The Committee is a working body without decision power, and the final decision to award the Nobel Prize for Physics is taken by the entire Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences, after having a first discussion in the Academy's Class for Physics.<ref>[http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/physics/prize_awarder/ Nobelprize.org: Prize Awarder for the Nobel Prize in Physics], accessed 2010-06-19</ref>
== Current members == The members of the Committee (as of 2019) are:<ref name="CommitteePhysicsNobelprize"/>
* Mats Larsson (Chair) * [[David B. Haviland|David Haviland]] * Eva Olsson * [[Thors Hans Hansson]] * [[Anders Irbäck]] * [[Gunnar Ingelman]] (Secretary)
== Secretary == The secretary takes part in the meeting, but cannot cast a vote unless the secretary is also a member of the Committee. Until 1973, the Nobel Committees for Physics and Chemistry had a common secretary.
